item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, November 3, 2024 at 8:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Touchscreens are out, and tactile controls are back (496 points | 371 comments)
2. Project Sid: Many-agent simulations toward AI civilization (22 points | discuss)
3. ToolGit: A collection of scripts that extend Git with various sub-commands (35 points | 22 comments)
4. pg_flo – Stream, transform, and re-route PostgreSQL data in real-time (43 points | 9 comments)
5. The DeskThing: the perfect desk assistant (47 points | 30 comments)
6. Programming Languages That Blew My Mind (2023) (59 points | 26 comments)
7. Create block devices on your computer backed by Redstone Memory (132 points | 25 comments)
8. gptel: a simple LLM client for Emacs (9 points | 2 comments)
9. A React Renderer for Gnome JavaScript (82 points | 33 comments)
10. Unix core utilities implemented in Haskell (165 points | 60 comments)
11. GoGoGrandparent (YC S16) Is Hiring Back End and Full-Stack Engineers ( | hide)
12. Missing open-source contributor presents a dilemma when accepting their PR (17 points | 11 comments)
13. Future Music magazine is closing after 32 years (8 points | 1 comment)
14. Speed, scale and reliability: 25 years of Google datacenter networking evolution (218 points | 46 comments)
15. Big Data for the Leviathan (31 points | 6 comments)
16. Turn your phone or tablet into a chess clock (19 points | 25 comments)
17. Coordinated Community Response Mitigates Fediverse Spam Attack (8 points | discuss)
18. Get me out of data hell (548 points | 222 comments)
19. The performance of hashing for similar function detection (22 points | discuss)
20. Programming NetBIOS on OS/2 (18 points | discuss)
21. The motor turns too much (349 points | 163 comments)
22. Venvstacks: Virtual Environment Stacks for Python (86 points | 35 comments)
23. Ractor – a Rust Actor Framework (131 points | 63 comments)
24. Matrix 2.0 Is Here (192 points | 60 comments)
25. Eighty Years of the Finite Element Method (2022) (185 points | 93 comments)
26. Weird Lexical Syntax (406 points | 213 comments)
27. Next Generation Out of Band Garbage Collection (157 points | 76 comments)
28. Ask HN: What would you preserve if the internet were to go down tomorrow? (101 points | 121 comments)
29. Spann: Highly-Efficient Billion-Scale Approximate Nearest Neighbor Search (2021) (115 points | 28 comments)
30. SpawELO – small free matchmaking system for LAN parties (171 points | 45 comments)
